intro: Alsodeia scorpioidea, commonly known as the scorpionweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a compact cluster, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and has a low-growing, sprawling habit.
